title: الْمَبْنِيُّ مِنَ الأَسْمَاءِ
description: Learn about المبني من الأسماء - nouns that don't change their endings regardless of grammatical position, including pronouns, demonstratives, relative pronouns, and more.

notes.title: Declinable vs. Indeclinable
content: Arabic nouns are divided into مُعْرَب (declinable) and مَبْنِيّ (indeclinable). Declinable nouns change their endings based on grammatical position (رَفْع، نَصْب، جَرّ). Indeclinable nouns have fixed endings regardless of position.
Most nouns are مُعْرَب. However, certain categories are مَبْنِيّ - they don't change form but still occupy grammatical positions (في محل رفع/نصب/جر).

examples.arabic: كِتَابٌ، كِتَابًا، كِتَابٍ (معرب)
examples.english: Book: changes form - declinable

examples.arabic: هَذَا، هَذَا، هَذَا (مبني)
examples.english: This: same form - indeclinable

examples.arabic: جَاءَ هَذَا: هَذَا في محل رفع فاعل
examples.english: This came: هَذَا in nominative position as subject

examples.arabic: رَأَيْتُ هَذَا: هَذَا في محل نصب مفعول
examples.english: I saw this: هَذَا in accusative position as object

notes.title: 1. Pronouns (الضمائر)
content: All pronouns (ضَمَائِر) are مَبْنِيَّة - both separate (مُنْفَصِلَة) and attached (مُتَّصِلَة). They don't change form regardless of their grammatical function.
Separate: أَنَا، أَنْتَ، هُوَ، هِيَ، نَحْنُ، أَنْتُمْ، هُمْ, etc. Attached: ـهُ، ـهَا، ـكَ، ـنَا، ـي, etc. All are مَبْنِيّ عَلَى [their final vowel/sukun].

examples.arabic: هُوَ: ضمير مبني على الفتح
examples.english: هُوَ: pronoun built on fatha

examples.arabic: أَنَا: ضمير مبني على السكون
examples.english: أَنَا: pronoun built on sukun

examples.arabic: نَحْنُ: ضمير مبني على الضم
examples.english: نَحْنُ: pronoun built on damma

examples.arabic: كِتَابُهُ: الهاء ضمير مبني في محل جر
examples.english: His book: ـهُ is built, in genitive position

notes.title: 2. Demonstratives (أسماء الإشارة)
content: Demonstrative pronouns are مَبْنِيَّة: هَذَا، هَذِهِ، ذَلِكَ، تِلْكَ، هَؤُلَاءِ، أُولَئِكَ, etc. Exception: the duals هَذَانِ/هَاتَانِ and ذَانِكَ/تَانِكَ are مُعْرَبَة (change with case).
Most are مَبْنِيّ عَلَى السُّكُونِ or عَلَى الْفَتْحِ. We say: في مَحَلِّ + their grammatical position.

examples.arabic: هَذَا: اسم إشارة مبني على السكون
examples.english: هَذَا: demonstrative built on sukun

examples.arabic: جَاءَ هَذَانِ / رَأَيْتُ هَذَيْنِ (معرب)
examples.english: These two came / I saw these two (declinable)

examples.arabic: هَؤُلَاءِ: مبني على الكسر
examples.english: هَؤُلَاءِ: built on kasra

examples.arabic: ذَلِكَ: مبني على الفتح
examples.english: ذَلِكَ: built on fatha

notes.title: 3. Relative Pronouns (الأسماء الموصولة)
content: Relative pronouns are mostly مَبْنِيَّة: الَّذِي، الَّتِي، الَّذِينَ، اللَّاتِي، اللَّوَاتِي، مَنْ، مَا. Exception: duals اللَّذَانِ/اللَّتَانِ are مُعْرَبَة.
These don't change form: جَاءَ الَّذِي... / رَأَيْتُ الَّذِي... / مَرَرْتُ بِالَّذِي... - same form in all positions.

examples.arabic: الَّذِي: اسم موصول مبني على السكون
examples.english: الَّذِي: relative pronoun built on sukun

examples.arabic: جَاءَ الَّذِي نَجَحَ: في محل رفع فاعل
examples.english: Who succeeded came: in nominative as subject

examples.arabic: مَنْ: مبني على السكون في محل...
examples.english: مَنْ: built on sukun, in position of...

examples.arabic: اللَّذَانِ / اللَّذَيْنِ (معرب)
examples.english: The two who: changes form (declinable)

notes.title: 4. Interrogatives and Conditions
content: Interrogative nouns are مَبْنِيَّة: مَنْ (who), مَا (what), مَتَى (when), أَيْنَ (where), كَيْفَ (how), كَمْ (how many). Exception: أَيُّ is مُعْرَب.
Conditional nouns are also مَبْنِيَّة: مَنْ، مَا، مَهْمَا، أَيْنَمَا، حَيْثُمَا، مَتَى، أَيَّانَ. Exception: أَيُّ is مُعْرَب in conditional use too.

examples.arabic: مَنْ جَاءَ؟: مَنْ مبني في محل رفع مبتدأ
examples.english: Who came?: مَنْ built, in nominative as subject

examples.arabic: مَاذَا تُرِيدُ؟: مَا مبني في محل نصب
examples.english: What do you want?: مَا in accusative position

examples.arabic: أَيْنَ تَذْهَبُ؟: أَيْنَ مبني على الفتح
examples.english: Where are you going?: أَيْنَ built on fatha

examples.arabic: أَيَّ كِتَابٍ تُرِيدُ؟ (معرب)
examples.english: Which book do you want? (أَيّ is declinable)

notes.title: 5. Other Indeclinable Nouns
content: Other indeclinable nouns include: أَسْمَاء الأَفْعَال (verbal nouns like هَيْهَاتَ، صَهْ), أَسْمَاء الأَصْوَات (sound words), بَعْض الظُّرُوف (some adverbs like أَمْسِ، الآنَ، حَيْثُ), and compound numbers (أَحَدَ عَشَرَ to تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ).
These all maintain fixed forms regardless of their grammatical function in the sentence. The i'rab says: مَبْنِيٌّ عَلَى [الفتح/الكسر/السكون] فِي مَحَلِّ [رفع/نصب/جر].

examples.arabic: هَيْهَاتَ: مبني على الفتح
examples.english: هَيْهَاتَ (far be it): built on fatha

examples.arabic: الآنَ: مبني على الفتح في محل نصب
examples.english: الآنَ (now): built on fatha, in accusative

examples.arabic: أَمْسِ: مبني على الكسر
examples.english: أَمْسِ (yesterday): built on kasra

examples.arabic: خَمْسَةَ عَشَرَ: مبني على فتح الجزأين
examples.english: Fifteen: both parts built on fatha

exercises.promptEn: Nouns are two types: declinable and _____
Relative pronouns are indeclinable except for the _____ (dual)

exercises.prompt: مَنْ وَمَا وَأَيْنَ مَبْنِيَّةٌ، لَكِنَّ _____ مُعْرَبَةٌ
exercises.promptEn: مَنْ، مَا، أَيْنَ are indeclinable, but _____ is declinable

exercises.prompt: جَاءَ هَذَا: هَذَا مَبْنِيٌّ فِي _____ رَفْعٍ فَاعِل
exercises.promptEn: جَاءَ هَذَا: هَذَا is built, in the _____ of nominative as subject

exercises.answer: The indeclinable noun (doesn't change form with grammatical position)
In the position of nominative (for indeclinable nouns)
Built on sukun (ends in sukun, doesn't change)

exercises.prompt: A noun that doesn't change its ending regardless of grammatical function
The phrase used to indicate an indeclinable noun's function: 'in the position of nominative'
The only interrogative/relative that is declinable (changes form)
